blockchain.models¶

What follows are the details of the blockchain.models implementation.

class blockchain.models.BlockchainTransfer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This model represents a transfer of crypto from one address to another. This is used for both when a user has purchased crypto and also when they are selling crypto.

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • to_address (CharField) – To address
  • from_address (CharField) – From address
  • amount (FloatField) – Amount
  • asset (CharField) – Asset
  • transaction_id (CharField) – Transaction id
  • status (CharField) – Status
  • start_block (IntegerField) – Start block
  • confirmed_block (IntegerField) – Confirmed block

class blockchain.models.DepositWallet(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A deposit wallet is used to represent a ‘temporary’ wallet that a user deposits crypto into this wallet is monitored so that when a user finishes a deposit, the system can send them fiat in exchange

Parameters:
  • id (AutoField) – Id
  • depositor (ForeignKey to PSPUser) – Depositor
  • wallet_file (FilePathField) – Wallet file
  • wallet_pass (CharField) – Wallet pass
  • start_height (IntegerField) – Start height
  • transfer (OneToOneField to BlockchainTransfer) – Transfer
  • transfer_to_main (OneToOneField to BlockchainTransfer) – Transfer to main
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

The bytearray of the address of this wallet

Returns:bytearray
